Module mesakit.map.geography
Package com.telenav.mesakit.map.geography.shape.polyline

Class Polyline

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.mesakit.map.geography.shape.polyline.Polyline
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Emptiness, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Indexable<Location>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Joinable<Location>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Sequence<Location>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Sized, LocationSequence, Bounded, Intersectable, Iterable<Location>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompressedPolyline, Polygon
public class Polyline extends Object implements com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Indexable<Location>, Bounded, Intersectable, LocationSequence, Iterable<Location>
A sequence of two or more locations that are connected, leading from a start() to an end() location. A polyline is Iterable so it can be used in an advanced for loop: 
     for (var location : polyline) { ... }
Poly-lines also have a bounding rectangle retrieved with Bounded.bounds(). It can be determined if the polyline intersects a rectangle or segment with Intersectable.intersects(Rectangle) and intersects(Segment), and whether it intersects itself with selfIntersection(). The point of intersection with another polyline or with a segment can be determined with intersection(Polyline) and intersection(Segment). Whether two poly-lines cross each other can be determined with crosses(Polyline).

Segments of the polyline can be retrieved with:

  • firstSegment() - The first segment of the polyline
  • lastSegment() - The last segment of the polyline
  • secondSegment() - The second segment (if any)
  • middleSegment() - The middle segment. If there are an even number of segments, the segment prior to the midpoint will be chosen.

Points along the polyline can be located with:

  • size() - The number of locations in the polyline, guaranteed to be at least 2
  • start() - The starting point of the polyline
  • end() - The ending point of the polyline
  • get(int) - The nth point in the polyline, between 0 and size() - 1
  • at(Distance) - The point at the given distance along the polyline (not necessarily a shape point)
  • at(Percent) - The point at the given percentage of the polyline length
  • midpoint() - The point equidistant along the polyline from the start and the end

Various methods help to determine the nature of the polyline:

  • isBent(Distance, Angle) - Is the polyline bent by more than the given angle within the given distance?
  • isStraight(Distance, Angle) - Is the polyline straight within the given distance and maximum bend angle?
  • isLoop() - Does the polyline form a closed loop?
  • isSegment() - Is the polyline just a single segment?
  • isConnectedTo(Polyline) - Does the start or end of the polyline coincide with the start or end of the given polyline?
  • bend() - The amount that the polyline bends to the left (negative) or right (positive)
  • closeness(Polyline, Distance, Angle) - Closeness of this polyline to that one as a percentage, where 0% is not at all close and 100% is the same polyline. The closeness is measured by considering segments that are within the given maximum distance apart and within the given maximum heading deviation
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • closeness

      public com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.level.Percent closeness(Polyline that, Distance maximumDistance, Angle maximumHeadingDeviation)
      Returns the percentage of this polyline that is within the given distance from that polyline. Areas where the headings of the two poly-lines deviate by more than the given maximumHeadingDeviation are not considered close, nor are areas where the poly-lines are more end-to-end than side-by-side.
